intro: Chamaesyce saltonensis, commonly known as Salton Sea spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, saline environments. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped with a hairy texture, and it produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Chamaesyce saltonensis is often found in disturbed areas and can be an indicator of ecological conditions in its habitat.
